what: Optional renv – currently included in GCAM 6.0 and gcamdata release
title: Getting Started with gcamdata
text: NOTE SETTING /RESTORING RENV VPN CAN CAUSE ERRORS HIGHLY RECOMMENDED AVOID VPN SET-renv R package dependency management. Using save private R library correct versions package dependencies. steps use renv include: Install renv package (already installed) Initialize local library (may prompt restart R session) Install correct packages (may take time) now set run driver without running package version issues. Note completed steps , R session automatically connect private library open gcamdata.Rproj. R session doesn’t connect (example, changed branches), can run following reconnect private library: See video tutorial :
code: install.packages( "https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/renv/renv_0.12.5.tar.gz", repos = NULL, type = "source" ) renv::init( bare = TRUE) renv::restore() renv::activate()

title: Getting Started with gcamdata
text: now ready run driver, main processing function generates intermediate data outputs xml files GCAM. two ways run driver:  driver_drake() runs driver stores outputs hidden cache. run driver_drake() skip steps --date. useful adjusting data inputs code running data system multiple times. reason, almost always recommend using driver_drake(). details can found vignette.  See documentation options running driver, outputs generate stop.

code: @Manual{,   title = {gcamdata: Prepare, process, and synthesize FAOSTAT data for global agroeconomic and multisector dynamic modeling},   author = {Xin Zhao and Maksym Chepeliev and Pralit Patel and Kanishka Narayan and Marshall Wise},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 1.1}, }

what: Prepare, process, and synthesize FAOSTAT data for global agroeconomic and multisector dynamic modeling
title: Prepare, process, and synthesize FAOSTAT data for global agroeconomic and multisector dynamic modeling
text: Functions R package (gcamdata-faostat) download, clean, processe, connect, visualize data FAOSTAT global economic integrated assessment modeling. package built based existing gcamdata package structure consistency, transparency, traceability. goals version : (1) Check FAOSTAT data updates download necessary datasets (2) Develop new method primary equivalent aggregation aggregate supply-utilization-accounting (SUA) data items along supply chain (e.g., wheat flour, bran, germ wheat-primary-equivalent). method preserves balance across space (trade balance), time (storage carryover), supply-utilization, combination dimensions minimal adjustments. (3) Apply new method primary equivalent aggregation aggregating FAO ~500 SUA (SCL) items ~100 primary equivalent items FAO Food Balance Sheet (FBS). (4) Compare balanced data compiled using different methods visualize difference. Copyright 2019 Battelle Memorial Institute; see LICENSE file.

title: evaluate_smooth_res_curve — evaluate_smooth_res_curve
text: Helper function calculate smooth renewable resource supply available particular price point relevant smooth renewable resource curve parameters (curve exponent, mid-price, maximum sub-resource). supply = ((p - base.price) ^ curve.exponent) / (mid.price ^ curve.exponent + ((p - base.price) ^ curve.exponent)) * maxSubResource Note can vectors functional form GCAM's smooth renewable resource curve documented : http://jgcri.github.io/gcam-doc/energy.html#renewable-resources
